business.headline: 'Making broke adults': Redditor's viral post shreds MBA salary dreamsA viral Reddit post lists some real offers seen on LinkedIn and compares the shiny package (CTC or cost-to-company) with the actual in-hand salary after taxes and deductions.

Job change and no EPF transfer? You might be losing 8.25% interest earningsWhen you switch jobs, your Universal Account Number (UAN) stays the same, but your EPF account with your old employer doesn't automatically move to the new one. You have to transfer it yourself through the EPFO Member Sewa portal.

Escalation in tensions with India would weigh on Pakistan's growth: Moody'sGlobal rating agency Moody's said on Monday that a sustained escalation in tensions with India would likely weigh on Pakistan's growth.

Sensex ends 294 points higher, Nifty above 24,460; Adani Enterprises jumps 7%The BSE Sensex climbed 294.85 points, or 0.37%, to close at 80,796.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 114.45 points, or 0.47%, to settle at 24,461.15.

India aims at financial strikes, pushes ADB to curb funding to Pak: SourcesIndia is seeking a reduction in international funding to Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing Islamabad of supporting terror financing and fostering cross-border terrorism.

ITR filing 2025: Key tax benefits under Section 80C, 80D, and 24BIn case you are opting for the old tax regime, under Section 80C you can claim up to Rs 1.5 lakh of deductions every year. This section covers several popular options, like Public Provident Fund (PPF), Employees' Provident Fund (EPF), ELSS mutual fund, 5-year fixed deposits and premiums for life insurance, etc.
Explained: Why Swiggy share price jumped 6% todaySwiggy's stock may have surged nearly 6% today, but it's still down 40% year-to-date.

'To save crores in taxes': Investment banker on why rich are buying farmhousesIn India, any income from farming is completely tax-free. That means if someone says they earned money by selling vegetables, fruits, or milk from their farmland, they don't have to pay income tax on it.

Ather Energy IPO to list tomorrow. Check allotment status, latest GMPAther Energy's IPO, which ran from April 28 to April 30, involved a mix of fresh equity worth Rs 2,626 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.1 crore shares.

Adani Ports shares jump 7% after Q4 results. Check target price, other detailsAdani Ports stock climbed to Rs 1,355 from its previous close of Rs 1,267.05, up 6.90% on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The upmove came after the company reported robust March quarter earnings and posted healthy operational growth in April, prompting several brokerages to raise their target prices.

Sensex rises over 500 points. 3 reasons why stock market is risingForeign investor inflows, strong macro data, and improving global cues have fired up the bulls. While geopolitical risks linger, analysts say the rally could hold as long as key support levels stay intact.

Kotak Mahindra Bank tumbles over 5% after Q4 miss. Buy, hold or sell?Kotak Mahindra Bank shares fell over 5% in early trade on Monday as investors reacted negatively to the lender's Q4 financial results. Despite some positives in asset quality, softer loan growth and pressure on core income metrics weighed on investor sentiment, especially after the recent rally in the stock.

entertainment.headline: Suriya on comparisons with brother Karthi: I can't be him, can't do MeiyazhaganSuriya shared his take on comparisons drawn by fans between him and his brother Karthi, during a conversation to promote his latest film, 'Retro'.

Lady Gaga's Brazil concert sees 2.5 million attendees, highest by a female artistLady Gaga made history with her performance at Copacabana Beach, attracting a record-breaking crowd and marking her return to Brazil after 12 years. The concert was not only a musical spectacle but also a cultural celebration, highlighting her connection with fans and the LGBTQ+ community.

Tell me who's at fault: Sonu Nigam responds to case over Bengaluru concert remarksPlayback singer Sonu Nigam issued a clarification after a case was registered against him for his 'provocative' remarks in Bengaluru. The singer claimed that he was threatened by a group of boys to sing in Kannada.

Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan seriously injured in car accident. DetailsIndian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan was injured in a serious car accident and is currently undergoing treatment in Noida. The accident involved his car hitting a parked vehicle, and the police are currently investigating the incident.

Case against Sonu Nigam over controversial remarks during Bengaluru concertSinger Sonu Nigam schooled a fan during his concert in Bengaluru after he demanded a Kannada song from him. An FIR has been filed against the singer, calling his remarks controversial.

Aamir Khan rejects sequel idea for Jaane Tu Ya Jaane Na, director reveals whyA sequel to 'Jaane Tu Ya Jaane Na' was rejected by Aamir Khan, reveals director Abbas Tyrewala. Despite fan demand, the makers feel the original's magic can't be recreated again.

Vettaiyan actor Ritika Singh shares weight-loss journeyActor Ritika Singh recently shared an Instagram video showing her journey to fitness despite a knee injury. She shared how she decided that 'it's time to lock in and look the best you've ever looked'.

21 years on, Zayed Khan recalls Main Hoon Na magic, bond with SRK, film's legacyZayed Khan was the perfect mischievous, spoilt, stylish younger brother to Shah Rukh Khan's Ram in 'Main Hoon Na'. As the Farah Khan-directorial completed 21 years, we spoke to Zayed about the film achieving cult status over the years.

Game of Thrones actor Iain Glen joins Anupam Kher directorial Tanvi The GreatGame of Thrones actor Iain Glen joined Anupam Kher's directorial, Tanvi The Great. This film marks Anupam Kher's return as director after over two decades.

Shekhar Kapur, Vivek Agnihotri slam Trump's 100% film tariff as 'disastrous'US President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 100% tariff on foreign films has sparked criticism from filmmakers Shekhar Kapur and Vivek Agnihotri. They have warned of potential negative impacts on the global film industry.

Devendra Fadnavis praises Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi film RamayanaMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis praised the upcoming film Ramayana, calling its production world-class after visiting the set. Directed by Nitesh Tiwari, the film stars Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi, and Yash in the lead roles.

Adnan Sami says Pakistanis told him 'We hate our army', shuts down trollsSinger Adnan Sami, known for his strong anti-Pakistan stands, schooled X users trying to troll him for his Indian citizenship in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack. He also narrated an incident involving Pakistanis criticising their army for 'destroying' the country.

Allu Arjun teams up with Ranveer, Jr NTR's trainer Lloyd Stevens for Atlee's filmAllu Arjun has joined hands with celebrity fitness trainer Lloyd Stevens as he begins preparing for his next, a high-budget actioner with director Atlee. The film was announced on April

Actor Gautami Kapoor wanted to gift sex toy to daughter when she turned 16TV actor Gautami Kapoor shared in an interview that she openly discussed intimacy with her daughter Sia. She also considered gifting her a sex toy at 16 to encourage informed choices.

Aamir Khan explores 'sabka apna apna normal' in 1st poster of Sitaare Zameen ParAamir Khan's Sitaare Zameen Par, a sequel to Taare Zameen Par, is set to release on June 20. The first official poster of the film has been unveiled with 10 debut actors under the direction of R.S. Prasanna.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui slams Bollywood, calls them 'chor' for copying south contentNawazuddin Siddiqui slammed Bollywood for lacking originality, accusing the industry of copying stories and songs, especially from South films. While promoting 'Costao', he called the current trend of sequels and remakes a sign of 'creative bankruptcy.'

HIT 3 composer Mickey J Meyer reacts to criticism for his music, defends scoreMusic composer Mickey J Meyer, who composed music for the recent Telugu film HIT 3 starring Nani and Srinidhi Shetty, has responded to criticism over his music with a post on his X account.

Actor claims 'House Arrest' host Ajaz Khan promised role in show, raped her: CopsA fellow actor has alleged that actor Ajaz Khan raped her on the pretext of marriage and a role in his show 'House Arrest'. Mumbai police filed an FIR against the 'Bigg Boss'-fame actor, while the investigation is underway.

Sidharth Malhotra joins Kiara in New York as she gears up for Met Gala debutSidharth Malhotra is currently in New York along with his actor-wife Kiara Advani. She will be making her Met Gala debut on May 6.

general news.headline: Pak cyber groups attempted to hack defence websites, personnel info compromisedPak cyber groups attempted to hack defence websites, personnel info compromised
Putin to visit India, tells PM 'Pahalgam attackers must be brought to justice'Russian President Vladimir Putin has accepted PM Modi's invitation to visit India, Kremlin said on Monday.

India aims at financial strikes, pushes ADB to curb funding to Pak: SourcesIndia is seeking a reduction in international funding to Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing Islamabad of supporting terror financing and fostering cross-border terrorism.

India snubs Pak, begins work on 2 hydropower projects in Kashmir: ReportIndia did not inform Pakistan about the work at the Salal and Baglihar projects, which is being done for the first time since they were built, as the Indus Waters Treaty had blocked such work, sources said.

Do you really need magnesium? Your doctor might disagreeMagnesium supplements have suddenly exploded into the market, with dozens of influencer-backed companies promising everything from 'glowy skin' to 'increased productivity' to 'a better night's sleep.'

Terrorists killed her husband, toxic trolls attempt character assassinationAfter losing her husband in the Pahalgam terror attack, Himanshi Narwal became the face of the tragedy. However, her appeal for peace soon made her the target of vicious online trolls. She is facing a tirade of sexist, hateful attacks, revealing how deep-rooted misogyny is unleashed when women speak up.

Escalation in tensions with India would weigh on Pakistan's growth: Moody'sGlobal rating agency Moody's said on Monday that a sustained escalation in tensions with India would likely weigh on Pakistan's growth.

No Jasprit Bumrah? 3 vice-captaincy options for India on England tourJasprit Bumrah may not be picked as vice-captain for India's five-match Test series against England later this year. But India can look up to other options to take charge.

Bitten by snakes 200 times, this man's blood can do incredible thingsScientists took blood from Tim Friede, who, according to his online biography, began self-administering diluted venom as a means of establishing immunity in case he was ever bit accidentally.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

Tell me who's at fault: Sonu Nigam responds to case over Bengaluru concert remarksPlayback singer Sonu Nigam issued a clarification after a case was registered against him for his 'provocative' remarks in Bengaluru. The singer claimed that he was threatened by a group of boys to sing in Kannada.

Tumble after Mandal: How VP Singh's caste gambit cost him PM's chairThe PM Narendra Modi-led Centre has decided to enumerate castes in the upcoming population Census. It was VP Singh, as the Prime Minister, who took the biggest bet on caste on the national stage, implementing the Mandal Commission report in 1990, hoping to gain from it. However, it triggered a series of deadly protests across India, and led to a downslide in his political fortunes.

The illusion of azaadi and Kashmir's historic deceptionIn part 5 of our series on the history of terrorism in Kashmir, we revisit the period between 1990 and 1996, when the Valley gave the illusion of a successful uprising

Live: Pak Army Chief says India's 'misadventure' to be met with swift responsePahalgam Attack Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday met Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh as India prepares an action plan against Pakistan following the Pahalgaam terror attack in which 26 people died. He earlier met Air Chief Marshal AP Singh amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. His interaction with AP Singh came less than 24 hours after a separate meeting between the Prime Minister and Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi, the Chief of the Naval Staff. The Prime Minister had also met Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi last week.

Why Indians abandoning their children at US border is on Trump's radarThousands of parents, including those from India, leave their children on the US-Mexico or US-Canada border in the hope that they will be taken in and granted American citizenship. This risky act might no longer remain a ticket to citizenship as Trump's Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is cracking down on this route.

After Pope Trump, White House depicts President as Jedi to celebrate Star Wars DayThe image, shared on social media, showed Donald Trump in flowing Jedi robes, flanked by bald eagles and American flags, with exaggerated biceps and a red lightsabre in hand.

Global airlines shun Pakistan airspace amid India standoff jittersApart from Air France and Lufthansa, some flights of British Airways, Swiss International Air Lines and Emirates are also avoiding Pakistani airspace, flight tracking data showed.

Third Indian student arrested in US in 2 weeks for trying to dupe elderly personA 21-year-old Indian student has been arrested in the US for posing as a federal agent and trying to dupe a 78-year-old woman. Kishan Kumar Singh is the third Indian student to be arrested in the US in two weeks for trying to scam senior citizens.

Pak says it test-fired Fatah missile, 2nd test in 2 days amid tension with IndiaAccording to a statement by the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), the missile test was intended to validate operational readiness and key technical capabilities, including the missile's advanced navigation system and improved accuracy.

Congress leader taunts Centre with nimbu-mirchi on toy Rafale, BJP feels the burnCongress leader Ajay Rai's use of a toy Rafale fighter jet, complete with dangling 'nimbu-mirchi', to criticise the government's response to the Pahalgam attack has invited the BJP's wrath.
Arunachal girl dances to Uyi Amma, brother's cameo is the big bonus. Adorable videoA video of a little girl from Arunachal Pradesh dancing to 'Uyi Amma' has gone viral for all the right reasons.

Jagannath Dham controversy: Mamata Banerjee doubles down as Odisha protestsAmid the controversy, the Odisha government also said on Sunday it intended to send a letter to Banerjee, requesting her to stop referring to the recently constructed Jagannath temple in Digha as "Jagannath Dham".
River Chenab's flow reduced as Baglihar, Salal dams' gates closedThe reduced flow of water downstream is the result of the closure of dam gates in Baglihar in J&K's Ramban.

Hit-and-run caught on CCTV: Thar driver runs over guard who objected to honkingAccording to the victim's statement to the police, a man driving a Thar SUV began honking loudly behind him. He requested the driver to stop honking, but moments later, he was run over by the Thar.

sports.headline: Prabhsimran Singh's father battling with kidney failure, only smiles when son playsPunjab Kings' (PBKS) batter Prabhsimran Singh's rich form in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 is serving as the only ray of happiness for his  ailing father suffering from kidney failure.

Liverpool confirm Trent Alexander-Arnold exit amidst Real Madrid interestTrent Alexander-Arnold thanked Liverpool fans as his move away from Anfield was confirmed, with Real Madrid links intensifying ahead of what promises to be a new chapter for the England star in Spain.

No Jasprit Bumrah? 3 vice-captaincy options for India on England tourJasprit Bumrah may not be picked as vice-captain for India's five-match Test series against England later this year. But India can look up to other options to take charge.

India slip to fourth in ICC Test rankings, maintain top spot in ODIs and T20IsThe Indian cricket team slipped to fourth spot in the latest ICC Men's Test team rankings as England rose to second spot to overtake South Africa and Rohit Sharma's men. However, the Men in Blue maintained top spot in both ODIs and T20Is.

Oscar Piastri fights past Max Verstappen to complete hat-trick of winsOscar Piastri beat Max Verstappen in the Miami Grand Prix and also took a 16-point lead over Lando Norris in the Formula One Championship.

IPL qualification scenario: Is Rishabh Pant and LSG's playoffs dream truly alive?Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) suffered their third consecutive loss in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) after being undone by Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 54 of the season. However, captain Rishabh Pant is still hopeful of making it to the playoffs.

"If we can field well vs DC, it'll have a huge bearing on the game: SRH head coachSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori has stressed the importance of good fielding ahead of their home fixture against Delhi Capitals. SRH still have an outside chance of making it to the play-offs despite being at the ninth spot, having six points from ten games.

Still batting well: Karun Nair not concerned with form before SRH clashIPL 2025, SRH vs DC: Karun Nair said that he isn't concerned with his form and is happy to have played cameos of late. Nair has scored 154 runs from six games at an average of 25.66 with a top score of 89 against Mumbai Indians.

Daniel Vettori brushes off fitness concerns for Mohammed Shami amid poor formSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori has brushed aside any fitness concerns for fast bowler Mohammed Shami amid his poor form in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

DC need to play with freedom, peak at the right time: Karun NairIPL 2025, SRH vs DC: Karun Nair said that Delhi Capitals need to play with freedom in their next game against Sunrisers Hyderabad as the race to book playoff berths intensifies.

Vidit Gujrathi relaxed before World Cup: Not taking too much pressureIn an interview with India Today during a visit to the Delhi Public School in Gautam Buddha Nagar for a chess tournament, Indian grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi opened up on his goals with the World Cup ahead.

"If we can field well vs DC, it'll have a huge bearing on the game: SRH head coachSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori has stressed the importance of good fielding ahead of their home fixture against Delhi Capitals. SRH still have an outside chance of making it to the play-offs despite being at the ninth spot, having six points from ten games.

Still batting well: Karun Nair not concerned with form before SRH clashIPL 2025, SRH vs DC: Karun Nair said that he isn't concerned with his form and is happy to have played cameos of late. Nair has scored 154 runs from six games at an average of 25.66 with a top score of 89 against Mumbai Indians.

Daniel Vettori brushes off fitness concerns for Mohammed Shami amid poor formSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori has brushed aside any fitness concerns for fast bowler Mohammed Shami amid his poor form in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

DC need to play with freedom, peak at the right time: Karun NairIPL 2025, SRH vs DC: Karun Nair said that Delhi Capitals need to play with freedom in their next game against Sunrisers Hyderabad as the race to book playoff berths intensifies.

Vidit Gujrathi relaxed before World Cup: Not taking too much pressureIn an interview with India Today during a visit to the Delhi Public School in Gautam Buddha Nagar for a chess tournament, Indian grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi opened up on his goals with the World Cup ahead.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
